abstract.text: Creates a monochrome color space based on primitives from Y’CbCr specifications.

inlineContent.text: Values that define the white point.
The transfer function.
A rendering intent constant that specifies how to handle colors that aren’t within the gamut of the destination color space.

Use this function to create a
instance to correspond with a specified white point and a transfer function. The

instance defines a monochrome color space. (A Y’CbCr color space is an RGB color space and a conversion matrix from RGB to Y’CbCr.) The white point provides the extent of a color space in XYZ space, and the transfer function provides the transformation from linear color to nonlinear color that the pixels reside in.

abstract.text: Make large-scale mathematical computations and image calculations, optimized for high performance and low energy consumption.
A flag that prints a debug message if the operation fails.
Creates a monochrome color space based on primitives from Y’CbCr specifications.
Creates an RGB color space based on primitives from Y’CbCr specifications.
A representation of the chromaticity of primaries that define a color space.
A transfer function to convert from linear to nonlinear RGB.
A representation of a white point according to the CIE 1931 color space.
A profile that specifies how to interpret a color value for display.
Handling options for colors that are not located within the destination color space of a graphics context.
A profile that specifies how to interpret a color value for display.
A pointer for accessing data of a specific type.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
A type for propagating an unmanaged object reference.
